placeMetadata.name: Karla Caves

sources.snippet: Not too far from Bhaja Caves lies another popular tourist attraction ‚Äì Karla Caves that houses the largest and most well preserved Hinayana Buddhist Chaitya in the country. Associated with Mahasamghika sect of Buddhism, these are one of the oldest rock-cut caves in India with the oldest one dating back to the 1 st century BCE. You will be amazed to see fine motifs, sculptures, inscriptions, stupas, pillars and 37-pillar aisle at Karla Caves that boasts of over 2000-year-old beams, amongst which some of them are still alive.

Located around 11 km from Lonavala, these Buddhist caves are just as significant historically as the Bhaja caves. With origins dating back to as old as the second to fifth century BC, these caves hold immense historical knowledge of the Buddhist culture in terms of sculptures and carvings.

placeMetadata.description: Ancient rock-carved cave temples housing a monastery, soaring halls, statues & intricate columns.
placeMetadata.generatedDescription: Karla Caves, located in Lonavala, Maharashtra, are ancient rock-carved cave temples that once housed a Buddhist monastery. Dating back to around 2000 years ago, these caves feature soaring halls, statues, intricate columns, and pillars that recite history. The site is associated with the Mahasamghika sect of Buddhism and is one of the oldest rock-cut cave complexes in India.
placeMetadata.address: Ekvira Devi Rd, Karla, Lonavala, Maharashtra 410405, India

reviews.reviewText: Ancient Buddhist rock cut caves near Lonavala. The stone sculpture, wooden works and other cravings are breathtaking. The rock cut staircase is a must see in the cave structure. We have trek all the way to the cave which is next to the Ekvira Devi Temple entrance. Parking is available at the foothills. Usually crowded as it is very near to the temple. Easily accessible entrance.

Good historical place. Do not go with your vehicle till the top. Park your vehicle at bottom parking space. Hire auto from there to go up. There are many stirs to climb so not recommended for old people with health issues.  There is holy temple next to cave. Best place to visit during monsoon.

The rock-cut architecture, carved from a single stone, is simply breathtaking. Every sculpture tells a story ‚Äî from the finely detailed deities and dancers to the massive elephants and guardians that stand tall even after centuries.

The intricate carvings are so well preserved that you can almost feel the devotion and craftsmanship of the artisans who created them. The scale of the temple leaves you awestruck ‚Äî towering walls, endless panels of mythological scenes, and the sense of standing inside history itself.

The Karla cave complex is built into a rocky hillside around 60 kilometres (37 mi) from Pune, with large windows cut into the rock to light the cave interiors. The caves are among a large numbers of similar caves excavated in the Sahyadri Hills in the early 1st millennium CE. There are altogether 16 caves in the group, with 3 of them being Mahayana caves. Most of the caves are lenas, with the major exception being the Great Chaitya, Cave No. 8.

Great Chaitya cave
The main cave, called the Great Chaitya cave, or Cave No. 8, features a large, intricately carved chaitya within a prayer hall, dating back to 50-70 CE. This is the largest rock-cut chaitya in India, measuring 45 metres (148 ft) long and up to 14 metres (46 ft) high. The hall features sculptures of both males and females, as well as animals such as lions and elephants.

Verandah inscription mentioning the completion by Bhutapala
This Great Chaitya cave, the largest in South Asia, was probably constructed between 50 and 70 CE according to the paleography of the various donatory inscriptions. Numerous donors, mainly local merchants, several of them Yavanas (Greeks), as well as numerous Buddhist monks and nuns, provided donations for the construction of the chaitya cave, as recorded by their dedicatory inscriptions.

It is worth a visit and you have climb so be prepared. Entry free is Rs25.
Plenty of parking. Visit during monsoon season.

The treck to the cave is mixed: park down as the road is very narrow, walking track has great views (but some locations aren‚Äôt good and even have garbage), it also becomes very crowded at some places, but the views are great. The entry is 25 rupees (cash is recommended as reception at top isn‚Äôt good for UPI) and the line is separate from the temple‚Äôs line; price is too high for foreigners (no reason for 12 times the price as locals). The cave has two exhibits: the Buddhist monument and hall, and the cave quarters. The monument is gorgeous (entry requires removing footwear outside) but the quarters (footwear allowed) are dimly lit and not very well maintained (but the views from the top are good). There‚Äôs also a Devi mandir on top and it becomes very crowded on weekends.

Karla Caves is a must-visit spot near Lonavala for history lovers and peace seekers. The ancient Buddhist carvings and grand prayer hall are simply stunning. The short trek uphill is worth it for the views and the calm, spiritual vibe at the top.

The Ekvira Devi Temple, nestled near the ancient Karla Caves in Lonavala, is a revered pilgrimage site with deep spiritual and cultural significance, especially for the Koli community who honor Ekvira Devi as their Kuladevi (clan deity) .

Tips for Visitors
Best Time to Visit: Early mornings are ideal to avoid crowds and the midday heat.

Amenities: Small eateries and local shops are available near the base, offering refreshments and religious artifacts.

Transportation: While vehicles can reach up to a certain point, the final ascent to the temple must be done on foot.

Karla Caves is a fascinating historical site, known for its ancient Buddhist rock-cut architecture and stunning carvings. The highlight is the grand chaitya (prayer hall), which is over 2,000 years old and showcases incredible craftsmanship.

Alongside the caves, there is also a temple of Kuldevta 'Ekvira Devi', which is a major pilgrimage spot for many locals. The temple is located right above the caves, and a separate entry path leads you there.

To enter Karla Caves, a ticket is required, which can be purchased at the site. Also, when visiting the Ekvira Devi temple, do note that sleeveless or western clothes are not allowed, so it‚Äôs best to dress modestly out of respect for temple customs.

The climb involves a number of steps, but the views, spiritual vibe, and historical richness make it worth the effort. A great spot for those interested in heritage, nature, and culture.

However, there are some ruined British era barracks seen on the way. Upon reaching the lake, there are some small stalls selling corn on the cob. Kune Falls, nestled between Lonavala and Khandala, is a breathtaking three-tiered waterfall and one of the tallest in Maharashtra, plunging from a height of around 200 meters (660 feet). Surrounded by lush green valleys and mist-covered cliffs, Kune Falls is a spectacular sight, especially during the monsoon season when it is in full force. The sound of the water crashing down, the cool breeze, and the scenic backdrop create a serene and refreshing atmosphere that instantly lifts your mood.

This waterfall is perfect for families, couples, and nature lovers alike. It‚Äôs also a favorite among adventure seekers who enjoy trekking, photography, or just spending time in nature. However, reaching the base of the falls may require a short walk or light trek, so wearing comfortable footwear is advised. During peak monsoon, access can be restricted for safety, so checking ahead is a good idea.

What makes Kune Falls special is its majestic drop in three distinct stages, creating a stunning natural cascade. The surrounding landscape is perfect for a peaceful picnic or simply soaking in the natural beauty. It's a great spot for clicking panoramic photos and spending quality time away from city life.

Overall, Kune Falls is a must-visit if you're traveling to Lonavala. It offers a combination of natural beauty, tranquility, and a bit of adventure‚Äîa truly rejuvenating experience.

Narayani Dham is truly a serene and divine experience nestled in the heart of Lonavala. From the moment you enter, you're greeted with stunning architecture, beautifully maintained gardens, and a sense of peace that's hard to find elsewhere. The temple is dedicated to Goddess Narayani and is a relatively new but grand structure with intricate carvings and a majestic aura.

The cleanliness and organization of the temple premises are impressive ‚Äî everything from the shoe counters to the prasad area is well-managed. There's also a small gaushala (cow shelter), and the overall atmosphere is calm and spiritual.

A great plus is the temple's accommodation and dining facilities. The bhojanalaya serves simple, sattvic food that adds to the spiritual vibe of the place. It‚Äôs an ideal spot not just for devotees, but also for anyone looking for a peaceful getaway amidst nature.

Well maintained and beautiful religious places where you will definitely feel the vibe and calm your mind and soul. Please book advance tickets for breakfast and lunch and they also provide accommodation with minimum cost and good facilities as compared to nearby hotels and resorts.

The temple is a serene and peaceful place, perfect for those seeking a calm spiritual experience. It is well maintained and kept very clean, which immediately adds to the positive atmosphere as soon as you enter. A thoughtful facility provided here is the free shoe-keeping area, making it convenient for devotees to leave their footwear without any hassle.

Inside the temple, there are three main deities‚ÄîLord Ganesha, Goddess Durga Mata, and Lord Hanuman. The arrangements and the sanctity of the space make it a pleasant experience for worshippers. Another interesting feature of this temple is that it offers food coupons on a first-come, first-served basis, which I believe are priced around ‚Çπ300 for lunch. I‚Äôm not certain about dinner availability, but it‚Äôs a great option if you‚Äôre planning to spend some time here.

For those who wish to stay overnight or longer, the temple also has rooms available for accommodation. I‚Äôve attached the visiting card in the photo for contact details so you can check and confirm directly. The temple premises also include a Gowshala (cow shelter), where you can feed cows for a small cost‚Äîa nice spiritual and cultural experience. Parking is not an issue here, as there is ample space for cars, and if you need local transport, autos are easily available outside the temple.

Overall, it‚Äôs a well-organized and peaceful temple that combines devotion, good facilities, and thoughtful services for visitors.

Lonavala, a hill station in Maharashtra, India, is a popular tourist destination known for its natural beauty and historical sites. Based on recent reviews and travel guides (as of June 27th, 2025), here's what you can expect:

Top Things to Do:

Explore Caves: Karla and Bhaja Caves are ancient Buddhist caves with intricate carvings, highly recommended by many visitors.

Forts and Treks: Lohagad Fort, Rajmachi Fort, and Tiger's Leap offer stunning views and challenging treks for adventure seekers. Duke's Nose is another popular trekking spot.

Waterfalls and Dams: Bhushi Dam is a picturesque spot, especially during the monsoon season. Kune Falls and Kataldhar Waterfall are also worth visiting. Pawna Lake offers boating and camping opportunities.

Other Attractions: Consider visiting Lonavala Lake, Ryewood Park, Imagicaa theme park, Aamby Valley, and Sunil's Celebrity Wax Museum.

Visitor Feedback:

Reviews are generally positive, highlighting the scenic beauty, especially during the monsoon season. However, some reviewers mention overcrowding, particularly on weekends, and suggest maintaining cleanliness in tourist areas. Bhushi Dam and Lion's Point are frequently mentioned as highlights, while some viewpoints like Tiger's Point are considered "overhyped" by some.

Tips for Planning Your Trip:

Best Time to Visit: The monsoon season (June-September) is popular for its lush greenery and waterfalls, but be prepared for rain and slippery roads. Winter (October-February) offers pleasant weather for trekking and sightseeing.

Accommodation: Book accommodations in advance, especially during peak season. Options range from budget-friendly hotels to luxury resorts.

Transportation: Lonavala is easily accessible by road, rail, and air. The Mumbai-Pune Expressway offers a scenic route.

Local Cuisine: Don't miss trying the famous Lonavala chikki (a sweet snack).

Remember that this information is based on current reviews and may change over time. I recommend checking recent reviews closer to your travel dates for the most up-to-date information.

You can visit during the winter months for the Strawberry Festival, which includes activities like folk dance performances and orchestra music. Overall, a very nice experience and great shopping. Don't forget to taste their different kinds of Jellies. One particular Jelly is served with spices and it tastes excellent. Hat's off to their staff members as they are very well-behaved. Found this cozy little spot while driving along the highway one rainy evening, and it‚Äôs now my favourite stop in Lonavala. Sunset Cafe isn‚Äôt fancy , it‚Äôs more like a small kitchen in the clouds , but that‚Äôs exactly what makes it special.

It‚Äôs run by a single vendor, who‚Äôs super kind and humble. There‚Äôs a nice little garden outside, and the view of the foggy clouds and hills is absolutely magical. The peaceful vibe makes it perfect for a quiet tea break with family.

I tried the corn pizza and sandwiches, both were tasty, and the coffee was warm and comforting in the rain. The fog rolling through the hills while sipping tea or coffee is something you just have to experience.

Highly recommend stopping here if you want a break from the highway rush and a moment of peace with nature.

A unique cafe in Khandala and Lonavala offers average food, but its clifftop location overlooking the express highway is truly exceptional.  Late night is the best time to visit. placeMetadata.name: ZENITH WATERFALL

sources.snippet: Zenith Waterfall is a beautiful mountain waterfall located near Khopoli, Lonavala. It is one of the best Lonavala tourist attractions and popular for its amazingly wonderful scenic surroundings. It draws a lot of visitors, especially during the monsoon season.
sources.shortName: 55 Places to Visit in Lonavala 2025, Tourist Places & Attractions

placeMetadata.generatedDescription: Zenith Waterfall is a stunning mountain waterfall situated near Khopoli, Lonavala. It's a popular tourist attraction known for its breathtaking scenic surroundings, especially during the monsoon season. Visitors can reach the waterfall by train to Khopoli railway station and then walk or take an auto for 3km. If traveling by car, it's possible to drive directly to the base of the waterfall and then walk 400-500 meters to reach it.
placeMetadata.address: Zenith, Dutta Mandir, Road, near Zenith High school, Zenith Colony, Khopoli, Maharashtra 410203, India

reviews.reviewText:
"Located in the heart of the Western Ghats, the Zenith Waterfall is a breathtaking natural wonder that left me awestruck. This stunning waterfall, situated near the town of Amboli in Maharashtra, is a must-visit destination for nature lovers and adventure seekers.

As I approached the waterfall, I was struck by its sheer beauty. The water cascades down a rocky cliff, creating a misty veil that surrounds the entire area. The roar of the waterfall is almost deafening, and the cool mist on my skin was a welcome respite from the summer heat.

What I loved most about the Zenith Waterfall was its serene and peaceful atmosphere. The surrounding area is lush and green, with dense forests and rolling hills that seem to stretch on forever. It's the perfect spot to relax, unwind, and connect with nature.

The waterfall is also a popular spot for trekking and hiking, with several trails that offer breathtaking views of the surrounding landscape. However, be sure to exercise caution when approaching the waterfall, as the rocks can be slippery and the water currents can be strong.

Overall, the Zenith Waterfall is a breathtaking natural wonder that is sure to leave you spellbound. Whether you're a nature lover, an adventure seeker, or simply looking for a peaceful retreat, this stunning waterfall is a must-visit destination." 5/5 stars.

‚ÄúUnforgettable Escape to Zenith Waterfall!‚Äù

What a hidden paradise! Zenith Waterfall offers a truly breathtaking view that feels straight out of a movie. The short 15-minute trek is not only easy but also filled with greenery and calm vibes ‚Äî perfect for anyone who loves nature. But the real highlight? Standing under the powerful waterfall and swimming in its cool waters ‚Äî it‚Äôs pure joy! A peaceful, refreshing, and soul-satisfying experience. Truly one of the best offbeat spots near Mumbai ‚Äî highly recommended for a quick yet magical getaway!

Mesmerising View üòç
Breathtaking view of waterfalls with a small trekking which will lead you to the waterfall is totally amazing and totally worth it.
A must go for those who like to take bath in waterfalls its nice place with leas crowd and peaceful atmosphere around greenery

Zenith waterfall is safest waterfall in khopoli area near lonavala. Its closed mostly on sunday.
There is no proper car parking here you just need to park on side of road. There are cahnging room available. Trekk is just for 15min and very easy . Please avoid throwing garbage and preserve nature. There are small food stall on the aoproach road where you can eat maggi pakoda vadapav tea ,corn and water etc.

I recently visited Zenith Waterfall, and it turned out to be a truly refreshing getaway! Located close to Khopoli station, the waterfall is not only beautiful but also quite accessible, making it an ideal spot for a quick escape from the city.

From Khopoli station, you can easily get an auto to the base point, followed by a scenic 15-minute trek through lush greenery and through the rocks and river that leads you to the waterfall. The trail is short and easy, suitable even for beginners, and offers a great mix of nature and adventure.

The waterfall itself is stunning ‚Äî cascading down into a natural pool where you can swim and relax. The surroundings are serene and safe, perfect for groups and families looking to unwind amidst nature.

Adding to the charm are the local vendors selling hot roasted corn, Maggi, and tea ‚Äî just what you need after a refreshing dip!

Zenith Waterfall, Khopoli, is a fantastic short getaway from Pune, offering a 10‚Äì15 minute nature walk, a family-friendly atmosphere, local snacks, and a memorable waterfall experience, most enjoyable during the monsoon season.

u can go by bike/car. A small walk for 5-10 mins and there you are. it's so beautiful and scary both. Not suggested in heavy rains coz it's risky. Good w Friends only. Not w family. Locals very helpful.

The accommodations are simple yet comfortable, emphasizing the spiritual journey over luxury. Visitors can enjoy delicious vegetarian meals with an emphasis on clean and healthy eating.

The hospitality and warmth of the ashram's staff added to the overall experience.
Gagangiri Ashram is a haven for those seeking peace, nature, and spiritual growth.

headerTemplate.blurbTemplate: Many of us love traveling on the Wanderlog team, so naturally we‚Äôre always on the hunt to find the most popular spots anytime we travel somewhere new. With favorites like [examplePlaceNames] and more, get ready to experience the best places in [geoNameWithThe].
headerTemplate.topBlurb:
Lonavala, a charming hill station nestled in the Sahyadri mountains of Maharashtra, is a treasure trove of breathtaking landscapes and picturesque spots that are perfect for capturing unforgettable memories. From lush green valleys to cascading waterfalls, this destination offers a stunning backdrop for photography enthusiasts and casual visitors alike. Whether you're standing at the edge of Tiger Point, where the views stretch endlessly into the horizon, or exploring the serene beauty of Kune Waterfalls, every corner of Lonavala invites you to snap that perfect shot.

As you wander through this enchanting town, you'll discover a delightful mix of well-known attractions and hidden gems. Picture yourself enjoying a steaming plate of Maggie at Amrutanjan Maggie Point, with the stunning valley views as your backdrop, or capturing the intricate architecture of the centuries-old Bhairavnath Temple surrounded by lush greenery. With so many captivating locations to explore, Lonavala is a photographer's paradise just waiting to be discovered. So grab your camera and get ready to explore the stunning sights that this beautiful hill station has to offer!
